Diploma in Computer Science.Overview: The Diploma in Computer Science equips students with theoretical and practical skills in software analysis, design, and development. Key courses include Fundamentals of AI, Data Structures and Algorithms, and Parallel Computing, alongside foundational topics like operating systems, computer networks, databases, and discrete mathematics. The programme also features a 20-week industrial training, providing hands-on industry experience to enhance students' qualifications and employment prospects.
AcademicProgression: Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Management Mathematics with Computing
Bachelor of Computer Science (Honours) in Interactive Software Technology
Bachelor of Computer Science (Honours) in Data Science
Bachelor of Information Systems (Honours) in Enterprise Information Systems
Bachelor of Information Technology (Honours) in Information Security
Bachelor of Information Technology (Honours) in Software Systems Development

Diploma in Information Technology.Overview: The Diploma in Information Technology equips students with the technical knowledge and skills for information systems development. Key courses include Web and Mobile Systems, Object-Oriented Programming, Cybersecurity, Interface Design, Information Management, Cloud Computing, and Computer Networks, alongside foundational courses in problem-solving, computer architecture, and database management. Students also complete 20 weeks of industrial training in relevant industries. Graduates will be prepared to effectively plan, implement, configure, and maintain an organisationâ€™s computing infrastructure and succeed in technology management roles.
AcademicProgression: Bachelor of Information Technology (Honours) in Software Systems Development
Bachelor of Information Technology (Honours) in Information Security
Bachelor of Information Systems (Honours) in Enterprise Information Systems

Diploma in Software Engineering.Overview: This programme provides fundamental knowledge in software engineering, fostering practical and analytical thinking skills in software development. It also develops basic managerial skills and encourages innovation for creating business opportunities. Additionally, the educational experience motivates students to pursue further studies and lifelong learning.
CourseOutline: Introduction to Data Structures and Algorithms

Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Managem.Overview: Management Mathematics with Computing is a programme where Management Mathematics is the major and Computing is the minor. It covers mathematical techniques for business management, including resource allocation, optimisation, applied statistics, and financial mathematics, while providing strong pure mathematical knowledge. Computing courses focus on software design, programming, and information management. Graduates can pursue further studies in business management, statistics, and IT, and achieve professional qualifications in actuarial science, financial planning, and financial analysis.
CareerProspects: Officers in financial institutions such as banks, insurance firms, and investment houses

Bachelor of Information Systems (Honours.Overview: Information systems are vital for supporting daily business processes and promoting growth. As their demand has increased, various functions like sales, finance, manufacturing, and HR are integrated into enterprise information systems to enhance performance. This programme equips students to solve practical problems in implementing these systems. It covers fundamentals of computing, Business and Information Systems, Systems Analysis and Design, Enterprise Resource Planning, Business Intelligence, and Information Systems Implementation. Students will also complete six months of industrial training, working on real-life projects in software development and data analysis, which will enhance their qualifications and employment prospects.

Bachelor of Computer Science (Honours) i.Overview: Graduates of this programme will gain technical knowledge and skills in computer science, with a focus on designing and developing interactive software. The demand for these skills, especially in mobile applications, video games, simulators, data visualisation, and VR/AR/MR experiences, ensures strong employment prospects. Students will study game development, programming, and graphics, while also building a foundation in artificial intelligence and human-computer interaction. A 6-month industrial training opportunity allows students to work on real-world projects in interactive software development, enhancing their career development and employability.

Bachelor of Information Technology (Hono.Overview: This programme equips students with technical skills and knowledge in information security, focusing on network and internet security, information assurance, systems administration, and secure software development. Students will explore penetration testing, vulnerability assessment, and forensics tools and techniques, learning to prevent, detect, and defend against internal and external threats. Additionally, a 6-month industrial training opportunity allows students to work on real-world projects in the information security field, enhancing their qualifications and improving their career prospects.

Bachelor of Computer Science (Honours) i.Overview: This programme trains students in computer science and data science, preparing them for careers as data professionals or data scientists. Graduates are in high demand for analysing big data to improve business processes and customer satisfaction. Key courses include Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Data Visualisation, Data Engineering, and core subjects like Programming and Database Management. Students will complete 6 months of industrial training, working on real-world projects that enhance their qualifications and employment prospects. Graduates will also receive a SAS Joint Certificate in Data Science and Machine Learning.

Bachelor of Information Technology (Hono.Overview: This programme aims to equip graduates with essential knowledge and skills for careers in software systems development and computer networking. Graduates will be capable of developing software across various platforms using appropriate methodologies and project management techniques. They will also be skilled in designing, configuring, and maintaining computer networks. Students will complete 6 months of industrial training, working on real-world projects in software development, network communications, or database management, enhancing their qualifications and employment prospects.

Bachelor of Software Engineering (Honour.Overview: Graduates of this programme will develop, manage, and maintain high-quality software using systematic engineering methodologies, including requirements engineering, design, testing, project management, and ethics. They will also acquire knowledge in areas such as human-computer interaction, mobile app development, web systems, blockchain, advanced databases, agile development, data science, and cloud computing. Strong technical, communication, and teamwork skills will enable them to be immediately productive in the software engineering industry. Students will complete 6 months of industrial training on real-world projects, enhancing their qualifications and employment prospects.

Foundation in Computing.Overview: The Foundation in Computing programme is the recommended pathway for students wishing to pursue bachelorâ€™s degree programmes in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information System, or Software Engineering.
